value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?  In this video I will try to clarify that question.  Dont miss part

value.title: DAX Fridays! #8: CALCULATE (Part 2)
value.excerpt: The calculate function is the most useful measure available in DAX. Let's go through how it works in this part 2!  Calculate Part 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-oDpOfhgmzA Download Power BI file:https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/calculate-dax  PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q4jePhzKtbU

value.title: DAX Fridays! #95: Binning, Frequency and relative frequency | Data profiler
value.excerpt: This is the first of a series of videos about data profiling and descriptive statistics. In today's video, I will show you how to bin data,  calculate the frequency and relative frequency using DAX.  What you think about the series? let me know in the comment box.  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/median-dax-functions

value.title: Combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX. Just a little bit of DAX! This can be useful when you want to use a single report tooltip for multiple Power BI visuals.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Dynamic labels in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick uses a little DAX, and the SelectedValue function, to get you some dynamic labels in your Power BI reports.  For more information about SelectedValue, check out Marco Russo's blog on the function - https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-the-selectedvalue-function-in-dax/  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: Dynamic Banding or Grouping in Power BI – Using DAX Measures – Choose the Size of Bins
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how to create dynamic bins by choosing the count of bins in a slicer in the Power BI report. In this video, I'll explain, how you can do it the other way around, which is by selecting the size of the bin, you will have bins and buckets dynamically generated. Download

value.title: Find Lost Customers Using Power BI and DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to use Power BI and DAX to find lost customers and new customers easily. If you want to see step by step blog post details, read it here: 'http://radacad.com/lost-customers-dax-calculation-for-power-bi

value.title: Power BI Icon Names for Conditional Formatting Using DAX
value.excerpt: I have previously written about conditional formatting in Power BI, and how you can take one step further with using DAX to dynamically change the conditional formatting. Conditional formatting with DAX for colors is easy, you can use the color name or their hex code. But for Icons, it is slightly different.

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. Article and download: https://sql.bi/27271/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Debugging DAX measures in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to debug a DAX measure that returns an incorrect result by using different techniques, with and without external tools. Article and download: https://sql.bi/782334?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: How to return 0 instead of BLANK in DAX

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hrhEjg9yYvE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Reading active Power BI security roles in DAX
value.excerpt: How to read the active security roles in a Tabular model for Power BI or Analysis Services by using a DAX measure. This way, you can use measures and calculation groups to customize a report based dynamically on security roles active for the current user. Article and download: https://sql.bi/803102?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/y3qw1vrB9Mo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the “sort by column” feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt
